      • NDPoint

        public NDPoint​(int dim)
        Create a new N-dimensional point at the origin (0,0,..., 0).
        Parameters:

      • NDPoint

        public NDPoint​(java.lang.Double[] pt)
        Create a point from a coordinate in an array of Double. The dimensionality of the point is equal to the length of pt.
        Parameters:
        pt - Coordinates of the new point.

      • NDPoint

        public NDPoint​(double[] pt)
        Create a point from a coordinate in array of double. The dimensionality of the point is equal to the length of pt.
        Parameters:
        pt - Coordinates of the new point.

      • at

        public double at​(int i)
        Obtain the i-th coordinate of the point.
        Parameters:
        i - Desired coordinate of the point.
        Returns:
        The value of the i-th coordinate of the point.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if i is not a valid dimension index for this n-dimensional point (i.e. if i >= n)

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo​(NDPoint other,
                     int di)
        Compares the i-th coordinate of two NDPoint objects.
        Parameters:
        di - Index of the coordinate to compare.
        other - The point to which to compare this point.
        Returns:
        -1 if the i-th coordinate of this point is smaller than that of 'other'; 0 if the i-th coordinate of this point and 'other' are equal; or 1 if the i-th coordinate of this point is greater than that of 'other'.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if i is not less than this point's dimensionality OR this.dim() does not equal other.dim().

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo​(NDPoint y)
        Compares this point to 'o' based on the first non-equal dimension (i.e. lexographic ordering).
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<NDPoint>
        Parameters:
        y - The point to which this point is to be compared.

        Returns:
